snippet: AOL had recently altered its 401(k) program, and its chief executive, Tim Armstrong, apologized for linking the move to soaring medical costs associated with two families’ “distressed babies.”
abstract: AOL chief executive Tim Armstrong reverses unpopular change in media company's employee benefits program and apologizes for singling out two families' health care issues as cause of changes; company had recently altered its 401(k) program, linking move to soaring medical costs associated with 'distressed babies' in employees' families.
lead_paragraph: AOL had recently altered its 401(k) program, and its chief executive, Tim Armstrong, apologized for linking the move to soaring medical costs associated with two families’ “distressed babies.”

headline.main: Facing Criticism After Remarks, AOL Chief Reverses 401(k) Changes
headline.print_headline: Facing Criticism After Remarks, AOL Chief Reverses 401(k) Changes
